meanings.definition: Olefines: a class of unsaturated hydrocarbons containing a carbon-carbon double bond.
meanings.sent1: The scientist explained how olefines play a crucial role in organic chemistry.
meanings.sent2: The factory produces olefines for various industrial applications.
meanings.sent3: The olefines at the party were the life of the celebration, always bringing energy and fun.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity flowed like olefines, connecting ideas seamlessly in her artwork.
meanings.sent5: The smell of olefines in the lab was distinct, reminding him of his passion for chemistry.

meanings.definition: Olefines: a type of compound used in the production of plastics and synthetic fibers.
meanings.sent1: The company specializes in manufacturing olefines for the textile industry.
meanings.sent2: She studied the properties of olefines to improve the quality of plastic products.
meanings.sent3: The olefines in the factory danced around, eager to be transformed into useful materials.
meanings.sent4: His words wove together like olefines, creating a strong and lasting impact on the audience.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of olefines in the production line caught her eye, inspiring new design ideas.
